body: A creature that successfully saves against a spell that has no obvious physical effects feels a hostile force or a tingle, but cannot deduce the exact nature of the attack. Likewise, if a creature's saving throw succeeds against a targeted spell, you sense that the spell has failed. You do not sense when creatures succeed on saves against effect and area spells.
url: pfsrd://Core Rulebook/Rules/Magic/Spell Descriptions/Saving Throw/Succeeding on a Saving Throw
name: Succeeding on a Saving Throw
